result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Alexi Schaub-Church

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricardo Alexi Schaub-Church in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Ricardo Alexi Schaub-Church.  Attorney Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing hearing.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.

Defendant Ricardo Alexi Schaub-Church in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ricardo Alexi Schaub-Church in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella; both appear by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer F. Rojas. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Ricardo Alexi Schaub-Church in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
